meanings.definition: To extend or project beyond a surface
meanings.sent1: The tree branches were pultruding out of the dense foliage.
meanings.sent2: The cat was pultruding its paw out from under the bed.
meanings.sent3: The balloon was pultruding so much that it looked like it might pop!
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was pultruding from her smile, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak pultruded against the clear blue sky, majestic and imposing.

meanings.definition: The act of pushing or thrusting forward
meanings.sent1: The pultruding of the door indicated someone was trying to enter.
meanings.sent2: The sudden pultruding of the crowd made it hard to move forward.
meanings.sent3: The pultruding of the toy car down the ramp was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a continuous pultruding force propelling him forward.
meanings.sent5: The pultruding of the waves against the shore created a soothing rhythm.

meanings.definition: A process of manufacturing composite materials by pulling fibers through a resin bath and then curing them
meanings.sent1: The pultruding of the fiberglass was a crucial step in the production.
meanings.sent2: The factory specialized in the pultruding of high-quality materials.
meanings.sent3: The pultruding of the fibers through the resin bath was oddly satisfying to watch.
meanings.sent4: The pultruding process transformed simple materials into durable products.
meanings.sent5: The pultruding of the carbon fibers resulted in a strong and lightweight material.
